intro: Loxoscaphe novoguineense, commonly known as the New Guinea loxoscaphe, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within lowland rainforests. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds for dispersal.
